metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25648 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way NSS handled CCS (ChangeCipherSpec) messages in TLS 1.3. This flaw allows a remote attacker to send multiple CCS messages, causing a denial of service for servers compiled with the NSS library. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. This flaw affects NSS versions before 3.58.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-25648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 3.61-1ubuntu2
libnss3-tools - 3.61-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> From SUSE and Rhel: This issue affects servers which are compiled against the NSS library. Other consumers of NSS like firefox etc are not affected by this flaw.

criterions.comment: nss package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.61-1ubuntu2').
